newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait MP wants AOC deal renewal linked to jobs.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait MP wants AOC deal renewal linked to jobs.

text.p: Kuwait should consider blocking the renewal of Neutral Zone drilling rights for Japan's Arabian Oil Co Ltd (AOC) for not hiring more Kuwaitis, a parliamnetarian said on Wednesday.

"The national workforce should have a (job) share that complies with the requirements of the contract" between AOC and Kuwait, said MP Waleed al-Jeri, chairman of a commitee formed to study the government's agenda.

"We (the committee), through the assembly, will push towards reviewing this contract and looking into the possibility of renewing it or not. Or at least to review the terms to achieve justice in this regard," he told journalists after a meeting with state oil officials.
By law, the government is not obliged to comply with the committee's views.

AOC's concessions with Kuwait and Saudi Arabia in the Neutral Zomne expire in 2003 and 2000 respectively. The two Gulf Arab OPEC heavyweights share the output from onshore and off-shore fields in the border area zone.

Jeri said the figure of Kuwaiti workers hired by the firm were "not encouraging," noting that AOC's agreement with Kuwait stipulated that its should hire a certain number of workers. He did not give exact figures.
Oil Minister Isa al-Mazeedi said in March Kuwait was leaning towards renewing the AOC rights.

AOC, which operates off-shore fields in the zone, plans to raise output to 350,000 barrels per day by the end of the century from around 300,000 bpd. Onshore fields are shared by Saudi Arabian Texaco and state-owned Kuwait Oil Company.
